body:
Do you have a bit more of that log?  I'd like to see what happened after the "Error sending chunk 586".

It might be that rclone considered the "connection refused" error a fatal error and gave up at that point, I'm not sure from the log.

Thanks very much for the reply, and for fixing my broken formatting in the original post (spotted it but was snowed under after posting).

I've attached the full log below. The second attempt copy operation is at 98% without any other B2 500 responses, however if you look at the logs you can see sporadic B2 401 responses occurring in attempt two. These are being handled by your low level retry code. B2 is also offering plenty of 503 responses when busy. Could it be that when B2 is busy uploads of some chunks slow to ridiculously low speeds (>24 hours per chunk) and the authorisation tokens expire? The existing low level retry mechanism appears to cover this, even if rclone aborted long running chunks and requested a new code the result would be the same (retry the chunk). Would rclone be able to request a new access token mid upload (I suspect not)? This may be a symptom of B2 being busy rather than a problem with rclone, sorry if I'm wasting your time.

Let me know if you need anything else, thanks again.

[rclone.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/1284115/rclone.txt)

I have fixed these errors here

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-139-g798502b2/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Please re-open if it doesn't work or you find more error conditions!

issue.title: Large B2 transfer starts over from scratch after b2_upload_part fails?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Either rclone restarted a large backup from scratch after uploading many GB of it because a single request failed, without retrying the failed request, or it's lying about the percentage complete the upload is and how long it's going to take to finish it in the logging it's doing after the failed request.

Neither of these is a good option. :-/

Note: this is a crypt destination on top of a B2 bucket (as the name implies).

issue.title: Copying to encrypted GDrive remote: "write:  broken pipe" doesn't get retried?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello, 

Just saw the following while copying from local to an encrypted Google Drive remote while running rclone v1.35-99-g6fc114dÎ² on Devuan 1.0 (Debian Jessie systemd-free fork) 64 bits, the precise rclone command line was:

`rclone copy --low-level-retries 100 --checkers 12 --transfers 12 -v --log-file=./20170224Z150635_rclone_copy_REDACTED /REDACTED egd:REDACTED
`

And here is the error line from the log: 
`2017/02/26 05:39:17 ERROR : REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED_flat: Failed to copy: Post https://www.googleapis.com/upload/drive/v2/files?alt=json&uploadType=resumable&upload_id=AEnB2UpXDdbm-LARKqeF61sVhpzHstC9I_NJ5WqyrhGVlW2ltBaQ4tru4X_z06ZQyOsH5cu1dkv7pE60d_D-X7_sCxEIfh3_Y6WDbtOpelHRNQWkiEORmyM: write tcp 192.168.0.250:59945->172.217.29.74:443: write: broken pipe
`

There are *no* "low-level retry" lines before or after the above, so the entire upload got scrapped (right after a "Transferring: " line reported 97% of its ~128GB uploaded... :-/ )

Also, no "high level retries" (ie, trying to send the file again from the beginning) either: the file simply got skipped, so I will have to run the above command again later, just for that file and possibly others that will get the same error  (the above command has been running for ~50h and still hasn't finished :-/ ). 

Cheers, 
   Durval

issue.title: Backblaze B2 large file copy fault tolerance

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.38

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

macOS 10.12.6 64-bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Backblaze B2 with crypt

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone: Version "v1.38" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--fast-list" "--verbose" "--verbose" "--buffer-size=256M" "--checkers=64" "--transfers=32" "--b2-chunk-size=256M" "--b2-upload-cutoff=256M" "--low-level-retries=1000" "--retries=500" "copy" "xxx.tar.gz" "crypt_backblaze:xxx/"]

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Large file copies (~180GB) to Backblaze B2 are failing on individual chunks, with a mix of the following errors -

-  HTTP/1.x transport connection broken: http: ContentLength=268435496 with Body length 86749635
- HTTP/1.x transport connection broken: write tcp x.x.x.x:56063->206.190.208.233:443: write: broken pipe
- Post https://pod-000-1093-18.backblaze.com/xxx: read tcp x.x.x.x:56064->206.190.208.249:443: read: operation timed out
- pacer: low level retry 1/1000 (error Authorization token has expired (401 expired_auth_token))
-- **Similar to #1660**

My internet connection isn't dropping but I suspect my WLAN connection is. I've restarted the transfer using a wired connection but it's going over the same Powerline switches as the wireless APs so I expect issues to continue.

Would it be possible for rclone / Backblaze to be fault tolerant when individual chunks fail? The behaviour at the moment seems to be that a single chunk fails due to a temporary connection drop and this causes the entire transfer to be restarted. I've set high --retries and --low-level-retries values, these work but still require the full transfer operation to be restarted. I was able to upload with v1.37 after multiple attempts, I've not tested in the earlier version but I've made 4x upload attempts all failing in similar ways (issue with a single chunk brings the whole operation down). rclone sync operations with are fault tolerant by virtue of transferring many small files, this is specific to large file transfer and many chunks.

Apologies if this request is asking for the impossible, I appreciate that the behaviour may be down to the Backblaze API. Thanks again for the brilliant work with rclone.

Here is some debugging output from rclone -

```
2017/10/07 18:22:45 DEBUG : xxx: Done sending chunk 37
2017/10/07 18:22:45 DEBUG : xxx: Cancelling large file upload due to error: Post https://pod-000-1092-03.backblaze.com/xxx: net/http: HTTP/1.x transport connection broken: http: ContentLength=268435496 with Body length 86749635
2017/10/07 18:22:52 ERROR : xxx.tar.gz: Failed to copy: Post https://pod-000-1092-03.backblaze.com/xxx: net/http: HTTP/1.x transport connection broken: http: ContentLength=268435496 with Body length 86749635
2017/10/07 18:22:52 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: Post https://pod-000-1092-03.backblaze.com/xxx: net/http: HTTP/1.x transport connection broken: http: ContentLength=268435496 with Body length 86749635
```
